body: Possibly caused by #8387, pinging @jp-bennett to take a look.
can confirm this issue, i have the same behaviour.

@mchilli and @kaanelloed can you go into settings, and audio, under advanced, and see if your Monitoring Device is set to something reasonable? It's possible that if it's still set to "Monitor of X" that value just needs refreshed to a real output device.
It is set to "default", but it doesn't matter which device i choose there is still no output. Also `pavucontrol` doesn't show any  output streams.

To anyone commenting to indicate that they have this issue too, please list the distro, the type of package (PPA/Flatpak/Unofficial) that you are using.

Arch Linux with PipeWire Pulse, Flatpak and Unofficial, can't reproduce, monitoring works fine.
Also curious if 29.1.0 had the same issue.

Not related to this issue, but related to people maybe trying to change their monitoring device. If you change your monitoring device in the settings you may need to disable and re-enable monitoring on sources afterwards as well.

i have this issue, too...
Kubuntu 20.04 with obs-studio installed from PPA:http://ppa.launchpad.net/obsproject/obs-studio/ubuntu

issue.title: v29.1.0 Media Source cannot be heard

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Operating System Info

Ubuntu 20.04

### Other OS

_No response_

### OBS Studio Version

29.1.0

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

_No response_

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/N9t765VBB4SG67ze

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

i expect to hear the media source when it is playing... in this case, the media source is a local mp3 file... the source is not muted in the mixer...

### Current Behavior

cannot hear the media source while it is playing but the level bars in the mixer are showing that the source is playing... the media source is properly heard in recordings and i assume it is also heard in the (twitch) stream when broadcasting live...

### Steps to Reproduce

1. in a Scene, Add a Media Source
2. in the Media Source properties, be sure "Local File" is selected
3. set the Media Source to play a mp3 file
4. all of the options below the file path are selected except the last one, "Close when inactive"
5. everything else is default


### Anything else we should know?

it used to work just fine... when i load the scene, the mp3 would be playing and i could hear it... i don't know when the problem actually appeared as i've not loaded OBS in a while but there have been several updates pulled in and applied...

in this specific case, i have a slideshow of solar system planets being shown while the mp3 is playing on loop... this sideshow is a group scene (?) that is included in a couple of other scenes... this group is used in my starting, intermission, and stopping scenes...

i don't know what else to add as it has been a year or two since i created the group and everything worked nicely at that point...

body:
> Also curious if 29.1.0 had the same issue.

Yes, 29.1.0 also has this problem.

> Possibly caused by #8387, pinging @jp-bennett to take a look.

After installed some CI builds, it's indeed after this merge that the audio monitoring stopped working.

> @mchilli and @kaanelloed can you go into settings, and audio, under advanced, and see if your Monitoring Device is set to something reasonable? It's possible that if it's still set to "Monitor of X" that value just needs refreshed to a real output device.

These are the same monitoring devices before and after 29.1.0, for me it's :
- Default
- Starship/Matisse HD Audio Controller Analog Stereo
- GP104 High Definition Audio Controller Digital Stereo (HDMI 2)

issue.title: libobs: Fix PulseAudio monitoring when device is set to default

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description
When the monitoring device is set to default, this bit of code was appending the no-longer-needed ".monitor' to the device name.

### Motivation and Context
Fixes #8877

### How Has This Been Tested?
Tested by Penwywern on Discord.

### Types of changes

<!--- - Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) -->

### Checklist:
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [X] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [X] My code is not on the master branch.
- [X] The code has been tested.
- [X] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [X] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.

body:
I've tested the pull request and it fixes the issue on my side.

Workaround in the meanwhile: In Settings -> Audio -> Advanced, select a monitoring device other than Default. Close and reopen OBS.

On 5/10/23 9:43 PM, David wrote:
> I've tested the pull request and it fixes the issue on my side.
> 
> Workaround in the meanwhile: In Settings -> Audio -> Advanced, select a 
> monitoring device other than Default. Close and reopen OBS.


YAY! i can confirm that the workaround does enable me to hear my local Media 
Sources via my monitor(s) again... can't wait for the code fix to be released 
(via the PPA)... GG to those that found the fix(es) to the problem :)
